channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024040099
item.description:
Report E-2024040099

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Roanoke, VA. The spill consisted of 1 cup of artificial strawberry flavoring, which released from 1-55 gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture.

item.title: Report E-2024040037
item.description:
Report E-2024040037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding loose bolts on the top of a 180-gallon metal IBC containing SCAV-OXÂ® 35% HYDRAZINE SOLUTION. Approximately 3-ounces of product released onto the top of the metal IBC. A Contractor was dispatched to tighten the bolts and clean-up the release. One drum of waste was generated containing impacted absorbent pads. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil was impacted by this incident.
